manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Master Tailgaters Replacement Tailgate Handle with Backup Camera Ram Tailgate WITH Backup Reverse Camera ( Full Color Camera) COLOR: Black For use with: Dodge Ram 1500,2500,3500 Years 2009-2017 Description: This is an aftermarket tailgate and camera, not OEM. For the power supply, you can connect it to any 12V power source. For example, if you wanted the camera to always be on, you can connect it to a 12v source that is on all the time, or if you only want it when you reverse you can connect it to the reverse taillights. Includes video and power extension cable, 8 Meters.

The Camera: The most important feature of this Tailgate Handle is the camera. Master Tailgaters is dedicated to providing the best camera: clarity, dependability and longevity. Each Camera is manufactured to provide a clear image. Not all cameras are made the same and we know that which is why Master Tailgaters never cuts any corners. In order to ensure a quality product, our cameras are double checked prior to shipping. Our cameras are designed to work in low light settings. We know that backing up at night deserves a clear and safe picture of your surroundings.

Sensor: ¼” On-Semi (USA) CMOS Active Pixel Array, Lens: Nidec (Japan) (Glass + Plastic)Minimum Illumination : .1 Lux light sensitivity Effective Pixel : NTSC: 728 x 582, PAL: 728 x 512 Electronic Shutter : 1/50 to 1/100,000 seconds Resolution : 600 TV line Angle : 170 Degree Waterproof Rate : IP68 Current Consumption: 120mA Max Power : DC 12V Operating Temperature : -4 to 167 Fahrenheit Installation of this Tailgate Handle is a breeze. Each of our Tailgate Handles include proper wiring. Prior to installing and running all wiring, double check to make sure everything is in proper working order. Issues? Drop us a line! Before purchasing check the back of your Monitor/Screen that you have a Yellow RCA input for easy installation. This tailgate handle is not recommended to be installed with Factory Navigation/Monitor units. It is possible but requires professional installation.

4.3" LCD Screen, Auto Adjusting Brightness LCD 4.3" LCD Screen, Auto Dim/Bright Adjusting, Compass & Temperature, Parking Lines 4" LCD Screen, Auto Adjusting Brightness LCD, Dual Way Recording, WiFi, HD DVR Auto Adjusting Brightness LCD ✓ ✓ ✓ Auto Dimming Mirror ✓ Compass and Temperature ✓ Remote ✓ Wifi ✓ Dual-Way Recording ✓ Screen Brightness High Brightness Ultra High Brightness Ultra High Brightness Backup Camera Included ✓ Works Great with Our Tailgate Handle Backup Cameras ✓ ✓ ✓

Why buy with Master Tailgaters? Master Tailgaters is a US-based company that designs and tests all products in the USA to ensure their quality. We carefully inspect every item and offer in-house support for prompt assistance. Choose Master Tailgaters for high-quality products and top-notch support from an American company.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars AWESOME Camera! Works great in my 2015 Ram 1500 w/Pioneer AVH-4100 NEX
reviews.reviewText: Master Tailgaters Dodge Ram 2009-2015 Black Tailgate Backup Reverse Handle with Camera Excellent backup camera for my 2015 Ram 1500. I paired it up with Pioneer AVH-4100 NEX. I bought TWO of these just in case I needed it. Though, I initially tapped the rear backup wiring as the direction suggests it, it did not work. I had NO error on my part (wiring). I don't know if RAM changed anything for 2015+ model or no, but the video would NOT turn on. Time for plan B: Ran the power wire from headunit. Bought a spool of cheap 20 awg wire from amazon and works flawless! Good resolution. Good night time image quality (thanks to super bright rear backup lights by RAM ;) ) . Overall very happy and please buy this. Super easy. See my attached pictures. Ask a question or two if you have. I'll gladly answer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good upgrade for non-equiped Ram
reviews.reviewText: Bought this as a upgrade to my 2015 Ram 2500 (crew cab; 6.5 bed) that did not come with the backup camera. Easy to install, easy wiring connections. I did have to buy some 18 gauge wire to run to front of my truck. The connection I was making into the factory head unit (5.0/RA2) because the wires supplied were not long enough. The RCA for the video was exactly the right length to run from the tailgate to the radio connections. I also added a larger wire loom to encase the RCA, power and ground wires into for an easier install. Honestly the hardest part was running the wire loom and cable tie-ing it under the truck and tucking it out of the way. I was able to come up through the emergency brake grommet (with a little widening of the hole) into the cab and not have to go through the firewall. The display has a pretty good "fisheye" effect but for backing up and not hitting something, it works perfect!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good image quality, odd wiring pigtail
reviews.reviewText: Plastic quality seems to be ok, not as heavy duty as the OEM and there are a few sharp corners that may need attention. Fit is good and easy to install and easy to move your existing tailgate lock over to. The camera come with about 12" worth of cable that plugs into the longer cable that feeds the RCA plug to the stereo, and allows for 12 v and ground. The 12v is fuse protected. The odd thing is it comes with a pigtail for the 12v and ground, but this doesn't fit anything nor is there an adapter for this included in the wiring. I simply cut it to length and terminated it myself. One important thing is that aftermarket stereos that have backup camera capability require a trigger to activate automatically when you put it in reverse. The trigger wire is not included, that would have been a great addition. The quality of the camera image is very good. There are no default backup lane lines built into the camera hardware, so whether or not they show up is based on each aftermarket radio.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value here
reviews.reviewText: Works great and fits exactly like factory tailgate handle. Cables seem to have good insulation and a quality loom. The video cable has plenty of length to reach the stereo head unit and the positive and negative power cables are about 4 to 5 feet long. The power cable length is not a problem if you are going to tap into a power source at the rear of the truck, like at the reverse lights. However, I wanted constant power only when the truck was on (not just when truck is in reverse) so I extended the power cables into the cab to be able to tap into power and the keyed power 12v outlet (I used a plug and play adapter from infotainment). It's only been a couple of days but so far it works GREAT and I am very happy with the value when compared the cost of a factory one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars NO PARKING GUIDE LINES UNLESS YOUR DECK CAN ADD THEM. Good other than that.
reviews.reviewText: I installed this on a 2012 ram 1500 while upgrading to a pioneer head unit. The product feels sturdy and they give you plenty of cable length to easily route with working slack. Overall picture quality is good and it works well in a low light parking garage.TWO NEGATIVES (just be aware of these. they may not be an issue for you).1. No parking assist lines.This was not highlighted anywhere in the product info and many of the customer pictures show lines. Some head units can add these to all cameras, but my Pioneer AVH391BHT cannot so I do not have them. Other similar product offer an on off switch for the lines, but this does not. It is confirmed by the seller in one of the Q and A questions. I would have chosen a different option if I had known this, but after doing all of the install work I don't want to return this and start again.2. Not as solid as the OEM handle.They specifically say in their description that they match the OEM quality, but it feels cheaper. Like lighter plastics. I don't think it will fail, but just not as high quality as they describe.INSTALL NOTESFor anyone who cares, I've seen a lot of questions on line on how to run the video cable into the cab so I'll tell you how I did it in a fairly easy way that does not require you to pull up the carpeting. Luckily this company gives you plenty to length in the video cable (at least for my crew cab standard bed). I drilled a hole in the rubber boot in the fire wall where the main wire harness enters the cab. It is a fairly easy rout to go from the back of the deck down behind your pedals and up to that boot entry point. After pushing through you can drop stright to the ground then pass long the frame where the other wires are, giving you plenty of easy zip tie points to avoid drag in the wire.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to Install
reviews.reviewText: was super easy to install in my 2017 ram quad cab. i removed the tailgate latch and swapped over the lock to the new handle. installed it in place and ran camera cable to secondary harness i fed in to the bed direct into the hole for the power lock in the tailgate. the fuse is a little fragile be careful removing it. i pushed in the 2 clips on the trailer harness plug to pop it out making it easier to get to the wires on the top 7 pin plug. wired for power to the 7 pin trailer harness plug (negative to center pin which is ground, positive to 8 o'clock pin which is backup running light). i looked and the best i could come up with is it is a 2 amp fuse in case you do break it. come's on when i put the vehicle in reverse and goes off when i put the vehicle in drive. not having it powered on entire time vehicle is running will give the camera a longer life before replacement. looks great and makes it easier to see the obstacles behind me below line of sight.

Update 04/06/2022: No issues so far, still works like it did upon install.It's only been a few days since I've installed this, so far it looks and works great with the PAC Audio kit. The quality is near identical to the OEM handle. The camera image is good, hard to judge on a small display screen. The installation was simple however the power and ground wires are much shorter than the video cable. I did not want to tap the tail lights or any other system; Instead I ran them directly to the PAC Audio harness by extending the power wires using 16/18 gauge electrical wire (commonly used for thermostats).A draw back is the location of the fuse which in my case on my truck, falls above the axle in a location that is not easily accessed by hand. I could have routed it differently but wanted to follow the same path as the the rest of the wiring from the tailgate. A quick disconnect would also be a good idea to locate between the tailgate and body.This along with the aftermarket PAC Audio harness saved me about $500 had I went to the dealership to install a similar item and the only real difference is I don't get the dynamic guide lines. Nbd. Plus the harness also allows multiple cameras to be added.

reviews.reviewTitle: For 2016 owners, you will need to extend power cable
reviews.reviewText: Looks great, have yet to install it but ****Update*** Been quite some time that I've had it in and love it!. Install was relatively easy, clarity is perfect. I also like the lines to see if the load moves at all. Highly recommend!!a few things:No wire loom around RCA cable2016 Ram reverse lights dont put out 12V, means there isn't enough power cable length to run up to front of truck. Wi have to extend the power feed cables .Will update once installed

reviews.reviewTitle: Fit and finish not great but seems ok overall
reviews.reviewText: Old latch came out easy. Key cylinder was seized so we installed into new latch but doesn’t work. After bolting the new latch in, it seemed loose from the metal yet solid at the same time. Gaps around the outer edge. Seems solid quality wise. Has been a month and video quality is still good.

reviews.reviewTitle: The tailgate handle broke literally the first time I used it .
reviews.reviewText: Power wires are not long enough to get to the cab , and if it is hooked into the reverse lights on a ram it wont work properly . I am working on a return but need to figure out how to get into my tail gate first as I have a cover on the box . Very poor product .

I had ordered the cheap handle first but I received it I was disappointed with the wiring harness so I returned it and ordered this one. I installed it today and it works great. Hooked it up to my pioneer head unit. Has the back up lines and the picture quality is very good. I would buy this camera again.
